intro: Schkuhria neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico false hellebore, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a spadix, typical of the arum family. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a waxy texture. Schkuhria neomexicana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
